channel.title: Where Does My Podcast Metadata Appear? (podcast-level title)
channel.description: (Podcast-level description) This is an example podcast feed intended to demonstrate where and how various pieces of podcast metadata appear in different podcast player apps. This description tag is plain text. According to Apple Podcasts, the maximum amount of text allowed in the podcast-level description tag is 4000 characters.
channel.itunes:author: Pacific Content (podcast-level itunes:author)
channel.itunes:title: Where Does My Podcast Metadata Appear? (podcast-level itunes:title)

image.title: Where Does My Podcast Metadata Appear? (podcast-level image title)

channel.itunes:summary: (Podcast-level itunes:summary) Plain text. No HTML. No rich text. No hyperlinks.
channel.itunes:keywords: podcast-level itunes:keyword, comma, separated, list, keywords, tags, pacific content

item.title: The Hare & the Tortoise (episode-level title)
item.description:
(Episode-level description) This tag allows rich text and hyperlinks using HTML. Apple says this should be "text containing one or more sentences describing your episode to potential listeners. You can specify up to 4000 characters."

Simplecast calls this the "Episode Notes"
item.itunes:title: The Hare & the Tortoise (episode-level itunes:title)
item.author: info@pacific-content.com (episode-level author)
item.content:encoded: (Episode-level content:encoded) This tag allows rich text and hyperlinks using HTML. Simplecast calls this the "Episode Notes"
item.itunes:author: (Episode-level itunes:owner) Pacific Content
item.itunes:summary: (Episode-level itunes:summary) Plain text. No HTML. Simplecast calls this the "Episode Summary."
item.itunes:subtitle: (Episode-level itunes:subtitle) Plain text. No HTML. Simplecast calls this the "Episode Summary."
item.itunes:keywords: episode-level itunes:keyword, frogs, ox, pacific content
